exorcism: The priest performed an exorcism to drive the evil spirits from the haunted house.
iterate: The teacher asked students to iterate the multiplication process until they understood it completely.
laconic: His laconic reply consisted of only two words, leaving everyone wanting more explanation.
ministerial: The ministerial duties included attending cabinet meetings and representing the government at international conferences.
nationalization: The nationalization of the railway system transferred control from private companies to the state.
pacemaker: After his heart attack, doctors implanted a pacemaker to regulate his heartbeat properly.
pedagogy: The professor studied modern pedagogy to improve her teaching methods for online classes.
permanence: The permanence of the tattoo made her reconsider getting it on such a visible location.
permissible: Using calculators during the final exam is permissible according to the new school policy.
persevere: Despite failing twice, she continued to persevere until she finally passed the driving test.
picturesque: The picturesque village nestled in the valley attracted thousands of tourists every summer.
polymer: Scientists developed a new polymer that could withstand extremely high temperatures without melting.
precinct: The police precinct on Fifth Avenue handles all criminal investigations in the downtown district.
predominate: Oak trees predominate in this forest, making up over seventy percent of all vegetation.
profitably: The company operated profitably for ten consecutive years before the economic recession hit.
proliferation: The proliferation of social media platforms has dramatically changed how people communicate worldwide.
prospectus: Investors carefully reviewed the prospectus before deciding whether to purchase shares in the company.
prudence: Financial prudence dictated that she save at least twenty percent of her monthly income.
pureblood: The kennel specialized in breeding pureblood German Shepherds with certified ancestral documentation.
reconsideration: After hearing new evidence, the judge agreed to a reconsideration of the original verdict.
redact: Government officials had to redact sensitive information from the documents before releasing them publicly.
redistribution: The redistribution of wealth through progressive taxation remains a controversial political topic in many countries.
refrigeration: Modern refrigeration technology has revolutionized food storage and significantly reduced spoilage worldwide.
refurbishment: The historic theater underwent extensive refurbishment to restore it to its original glory.
regenerate: Salamanders can regenerate lost limbs, making them fascinating subjects for scientific research.
regeneration: Urban regeneration projects transformed the abandoned warehouses into trendy residential lofts and art galleries.
regent: The young prince's uncle served as regent until the heir reached his eighteenth birthday.
reinstatement: The union successfully negotiated the reinstatement of workers who had been wrongfully dismissed.
repentance: His genuine repentance for the crime moved the judge to reduce his sentence considerably.
repentant: The repentant thief returned the stolen jewelry and apologized sincerely to the victims.
reprimand: The manager issued a formal reprimand to employees who repeatedly arrived late to work.
resin: Pine trees produce sticky resin that hardens over time and can preserve ancient insects.
rigorously: Scientists rigorously tested the new vaccine through multiple clinical trials before public release.
roundtable: Industry leaders gathered for a roundtable discussion about sustainable business practices and environmental responsibility.
rowdy: The rowdy crowd at the concert pushed and shoved, forcing security to intervene.
rudder: The ship's rudder broke during the storm, leaving the vessel unable to steer properly.
sectarian: Sectarian violence between different religious groups escalated into a devastating civil war.
sinuous: The sinuous mountain road twisted through fifteen hairpin turns before reaching the summit.
soliloquy: Hamlet's famous soliloquy begins with the immortal words, to be or not to be.
vindictive: Her vindictive nature led her to seek revenge against anyone who had wronged her.
vivacious: The vivacious performer captivated the audience with her energetic dance moves and infectious smile.
vociferous: Vociferous protesters gathered outside city hall, demanding immediate action on climate change.
whimsical: The children's book featured whimsical illustrations of talking animals having tea parties in clouds.
abyssal: Marine biologists study abyssal zones where sunlight never penetrates and pressure is extremely high.
acephalous: The acephalous organization operated without any central leadership or hierarchical structure whatsoever.
afflatus: The poet claimed that divine afflatus struck him suddenly, inspiring his greatest work.
agglomerate: Small villages began to agglomerate into larger towns as the population steadily increased.
aggrieve: The unfair treatment continued to aggrieve workers who felt their complaints were being ignored.
alliteration: Peter Piper picked a peck of pickled peppers is a famous example of alliteration.
allotrope: Diamond and graphite are different allotropes of carbon with vastly different physical properties.
